data.title: Llano County November: cool air, warm welcomes, and lots to do
data.meta_description: The November air is cooler, but a Llano County  welcome remains as warm as ever, no matter the weather. This month, shop for gifts and holiday meal f
data.text:
The November air is cooler, but a Llano County welcome remains as warm as ever, no matter the weather. This month, shop for gifts and holiday meal fixings, meet your friends or make new ones at a ladies’ night out, feast on a fried fish lunch while supporting a worthy cause, and wrap it all up with classical holiday music.

LLANO FARMERS AND CRAFTERS MARKET

9 a.m.-1 p.m. Saturday, Nov. 4 & 18

Courthouse Square in Llano

Come to the square for farm-fresh fruits and veggies, homemade preserves and salsas, locally harvested honey, handcrafted gift items, and more.

CHRISTMAS MARKET AT KINGSLAND HOUSE OF ARTS & CRAFTS

10 a.m.-5 p.m. Friday, Nov. 10

9 a.m.-4 p.m. Saturday, Nov. 11

112 W. Chamberlain St. in Kingsland

Shop for handmade creations by area artisans and bid on silent auction items. Food, drink, and desserts available.

BOYS & GIRLS CLUB OF LLANO FISH FRY

11:30 a.m.-2 p.m. Saturday, Nov. 11

2249 RM 152 in Llano

Fried fish and all the fixings. Dine in or grab and go. Minimum $15 donation benefiting the Boys & Girls Club of Llano.

GIRLS’ NIGHT OUT AT LLANO BEER COMPANY

6-8 p.m. Wednesday, Nov. 15

105 E. Main St. in Llano

Meet up with your gal pals for a couple of hours of trivia, prizes, drink specials, and snacks.

HANDEL’S MESSIAH IN CONCERT

4-6 p.m. Sunday, Nov. 19

8303 RR 1431 in Buchanan Dam

The Highland Lakes Classical Chorus performs George Frideric Handel’s most famous work, composed in 1741.
